posts.title: Everyday
posts.excerpt: Quote: Every Day was a film that German avant-garde filmmaker Hans Richter made as part of a film production course run by the Film Society. It features filmmaker Sergei Eisenstein playing a policeman, whilst Len Lye and Basil Wright provided technical assistance. These contributions reflect the sense of internationalism occurring at this time in British …

posts._title: Jean-Luc Godard & Jean-Pierre Gorin – Letter to Jane: An Investigation About a Still (1972)
posts.title: Letter to Jane: An Investigation About a Still
posts.excerpt: Letter to Jane is a 1972 French postscript film to Tout Va Bien directed by Jean-Luc Godard and Jean-Pierre Gorin and made under the auspices of the Dziga Vertov Group. Narrated in a back-and-forth style by both Godard and Gorin, the film serves as a 52-minute cinematic essay that deconstructs a single news photograph of …

posts.title: Blackmail [Silent Version]
posts.excerpt: about the production The film began production as a silent film. To cash in on the new found popularity of talkies the film’s producers, British International Pictures, gave Hitchcock the go-ahead to film a portion of the movie in sound. Hitchcock thought the idea absurd and surreptitiously filmed almost the entire feature in sound along …

posts._title: Pál Sándor – Szabadíts meg a gonosztól aka Deliver Us from the Devil (1979)
posts.title: Szabadíts meg a gonosztól
posts.excerpt: A Hungarian masterpiece from Sándor Pál. The film’s story take place in Budapest, in 1944 in the very end of the 2nd WW. The film’s photographer, Elemér Ragályi won prize in Montreal in 1979. Montreal, 1979. PLOT DESCRIPTION In this very dark comedy, the loss of a coat from a dance hall cloakroom sets off …

posts._title: Emile de Antonio – Mr. Hoover and I (1989)
posts.title: Mr Hoover and I
posts.excerpt: Description: Turning the camera on himself and his 10,000-page FBI file, radical documentary filmmaker Emile de Antonio skewers the legacy of FBI chief J. Edgar Hoover while offering up a fascinating self-portrait in his final film. A lengthy conversation with the composer John Cage, a discussion with a college crowd about McCarthyism and numerous witty …

posts._title: Morten Arnfred – Måske ku’ vi aka Could We Maybe (1976)
posts.title: Måske ku’ vi
posts.excerpt: During a bank holdup, an early teenaged boy and girl (Karl Wagner and Marianne Svendsen) are taken hostage by the robbers. After a very pleasant captivity, during which they play Monopoly with their captors, they escape into the countryside. The two consummate their first love and have a number of delightful adventures but eventually must …

posts.title: Honey Bunny
posts.excerpt: Honey Bunny” is a short film/music video directed by Vincent Gallo. The music on this video appears on Gallo’s debut album “When” (released on Warp Records in 2001).

posts._title: King Vidor – Truth And Illusion: An Introduction To Metaphysics (1965)
posts.title: Truth And Illusion: An Introduction To Metaphysics
posts.excerpt: Quote: “It started when I simply wrote a narration that interested me and challenged myself to fit it to a film, using existing ob­jects in nature, without animation techniques of any kind. posts._title: Alessandro Blasetti – 4 passi fra le nuvole AKA Four Steps in the Clouds (1942)
posts.title: 4 passi fra le nuvole
posts.excerpt: Quote: Originally released in 1942, Four Steps in the Clouds (Quattro Passi fra le Nuvole) was a major stepping stone in the starring career of Gino Cervi. The story begins as young unwed mother-to-be Maria (Adriana Benetti) desperately casts about for a means of avoiding disgrace. Making the acquaintance of good-natured Paolo Bianchi (Cervi), Maria …

posts.title: Fasle Baranhaye Mousemi
posts.excerpt: Sina, a sixteen years old teenager from today’s Tehranian middle class, experiences a new life on the verge of his parents’ divorce. Added to his very real sense of having been abandoned is the threat of a local thug who believes that Sina owes him a considerable sum of money. Things become even more complicated …
